content:
The University of Maryland places a high priority on interdisciplinary research among its academic departments by creating frameworks that foster collaboration amongst researchers, promoting the integration of research domains, and providing ample funding resources.

The university implements various initiatives to support interdisciplinary research, such as establishing collaborative research centers and institutes, building interdisciplinary research teams, and creating interdisciplinary graduate programs. These initiatives bring faculty and researchers from different disciplines and departments together to address complex and interdisciplinary research questions.

Additionally, the university regularly organizes interdisciplinary research symposia, workshops, and conferences to facilitate discussions, exchange of ideas, and partnerships amongst researchers. Such activities help researchers to find common ground and identify opportunities for collaboration.

The University of Maryland also provides funding opportunities for interdisciplinary research that address societal challenges, such as climate change and health care. Researchers can apply for seed grants, fellowships, and other funding programs to support their interdisciplinary research projects.

Finally, the University of Maryland encourages faculty and researchers to engage with industries, government agencies, and non-profit organizations to apply interdisciplinary research findings to real-world problems. Such engagement not only benefits society but also enhances the research impact of the university.
